014package org.jdbi.v3.core.statement;
015
016import java.sql.SQLException;
017import java.sql.Statement;
018import java.time.temporal.ChronoUnit;
019import java.util.AbstractMap;
020import java.util.Collection;
021import java.util.Collections;
022import java.util.HashMap;
023import java.util.Map;
024import java.util.Map.Entry;
025import java.util.Optional;
026import java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList;
027import java.util.function.Function;
028
029import javax.annotation.Nullable;
030
031import com.github.benmanes.caffeine.cache.Cache;
032import com.github.benmanes.caffeine.cache.Caffeine;
033import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiConfig;
034import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Beta;
035
036/**
037 * Configuration holder for {@link SqlStatement}s.
038 */
039public final class SqlStatements implements JdbiConfig<SqlStatements> {
040
041    private final Map<String, Object> attributes;
042    private TemplateEngine templateEngine;
043    private Cache<Entry<TemplateEngine, String>, Function<StatementContext, String>> templateCache;
044    private SqlParser sqlParser;
045    private SqlLogger sqlLogger;
046    private Integer queryTimeout;
047    private boolean allowUnusedBindings;
048    private final Collection<StatementCustomizer> customizers = new CopyOnWriteArrayList<>();
049
050    public SqlStatements() {
051        attributes = Collections.synchronizedMap(new HashMap<>());
052        templateEngine = new DefinedAttributeTemplateEngine();
053        sqlParser = new ColonPrefixSqlParser();
054        sqlLogger = SqlLogger.NOP_SQL_LOGGER;
055        queryTimeout = null;
056        templateCache = Caffeine.newBuilder().maximumSize(1_000).build();
057    }
058
059    private SqlStatements(SqlStatements that) {
060        this.attributes = Collections.synchronizedMap(that.getAttributes()); // already copied
061        this.templateEngine = that.templateEngine;
062        this.sqlParser = that.sqlParser;
063        this.sqlLogger = that.sqlLogger;
064        this.queryTimeout = that.queryTimeout;
065        this.allowUnusedBindings = that.allowUnusedBindings;
066        this.customizers.addAll(that.customizers);
067        this.templateCache = that.templateCache;
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * Define an attribute for {@link StatementContext} for statements executed by Jdbi.
072     *
073     * @param key   the key for the attribute
074     * @param value the value for the attribute
075     * @return this
076     */
077    public SqlStatements define(String key, Object value) {
078        attributes.put(key, value);
079        return this;
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Defines attributes for each key/value pair in the Map.
084     *
085     * @param values map of attributes to define.
086     * @return this
087     */
088    public SqlStatements defineMap(final Map<String, ?> values) {
089        if (values != null) {
090            attributes.putAll(values);
091        }
092        return this;
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Obtain the value of an attribute
097     *
098     * @param key the name of the attribute
099     * @return the value of the attribute
100     */
101    public Object getAttribute(String key) {
102        return attributes.get(key);
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Returns the attributes which will be applied to {@link SqlStatement SQL statements} created by Jdbi.
107     *
108     * @return the defined attributes.
109     */
110    public Map<String, Object> getAttributes() {
111        return new HashMap<>(attributes);
112    }
113
114    /**
115     * Provides a means for custom statement modification. Common customizations
116     * have their own methods, such as {@link Query#setMaxRows(int)}
117     *
118     * @param customizer instance to be used to customize a statement
119     * @return this
120     */
121    public SqlStatements addCustomizer(final StatementCustomizer customizer) {
122        this.customizers.add(customizer);
123        return this;
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * Returns the {@link TemplateEngine} which renders the SQL template.
128     *
129     * @return the template engine which renders the SQL template prior to
130     * parsing parameters.
131     */
132    public TemplateEngine getTemplateEngine() {
133        return templateEngine;
134    }
135
136    /**
137     * Sets the {@link TemplateEngine} used to render SQL for all
138     * {@link SqlStatement SQL statements} executed by Jdbi. The default
139     * engine replaces <code>&lt;name&gt;</code>-style tokens
140     * with attributes {@link StatementContext#define(String, Object) defined}
141     * on the statement context.
142     *
143     * @param templateEngine the new template engine.
144     * @return this
145     */
146    public SqlStatements setTemplateEngine(TemplateEngine templateEngine) {
147        this.templateEngine = templateEngine;
148        return this;
149    }
150
151    /**
152     * Sets the Caffeine cache used to avoid repeatedly parsing SQL statements.
153     * @param caffeineSpec the cache builder to use to cache parsed SQL
154     * @return this
155     */
156    @Beta
157    public SqlStatements setTemplateCache(Caffeine<Object, Object> caffeineSpec) {
158        templateCache = caffeineSpec.build();
159        return this;
160    }
161
162    public SqlParser getSqlParser() {
163        return sqlParser;
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Sets the {@link SqlParser} used to parse parameters in SQL statements
168     * executed by Jdbi. The default parses colon-prefixed named parameter
169     * tokens, e.g. <code>:name</code>.
170     *
171     * @param sqlParser the new SQL parser.
172     * @return this
173     */
174    public SqlStatements setSqlParser(SqlParser sqlParser) {
175        this.sqlParser = sqlParser;
176        return this;
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * @return the timing collector
181     *
182     * @deprecated use {@link #getSqlLogger} instead
183     */
184    @Deprecated
185    public TimingCollector getTimingCollector() {
186        return (elapsed, ctx) -> sqlLogger.logAfterExecution(ctx);
187    }
188
189    /**
190     * Sets the {@link TimingCollector} used to collect timing about the {@link SqlStatement SQL statements} executed
191     * by Jdbi. The default collector does nothing.
192     *
193     * @deprecated use {@link #setSqlLogger} instead
194     * @param timingCollector the new timing collector
195     * @return this
196     */
197    @Deprecated
198    public SqlStatements setTimingCollector(TimingCollector timingCollector) {
199        this.sqlLogger = timingCollector == null ? SqlLogger.NOP_SQL_LOGGER : new SqlLogger() {
200            @Override
201            public void logAfterExecution(StatementContext context) {
202                timingCollector.collect(context.getElapsedTime(ChronoUnit.NANOS), context);
203            }
204        };
205        return this;
206    }
207
208    public SqlLogger getSqlLogger() {
209        return sqlLogger;
210    }
211
212    public SqlStatements setSqlLogger(SqlLogger sqlLogger) {
213        this.sqlLogger = sqlLogger == null ? SqlLogger.NOP_SQL_LOGGER : sqlLogger;
214        return this;
215    }
216
217    @Beta
218    public Integer getQueryTimeout() {
219        return queryTimeout;
220    }
221
222    /**
223     * Jdbi does not implement its own timeout mechanism: it simply calls {@link java.sql.Statement#setQueryTimeout}, leaving timeout handling to your jdbc driver.
224     *
225     * @param seconds the time in seconds to wait for a query to complete; 0 to disable the timeout; null to leave it at defaults (i.e. Jdbi will not call {@code setQueryTimeout(int)})
226     * @return this
227     */
228    @Beta
229    public SqlStatements setQueryTimeout(@Nullable Integer seconds) {
230        if (seconds != null && seconds < 0) {
231            throw new IllegalArgumentException("queryTimeout must not be < 0");
232        }
233        this.queryTimeout = seconds;
234        return this;
235    }
236
237    public boolean isUnusedBindingAllowed() {
238        return allowUnusedBindings;
239    }
240
241    /**
242     * Sets whether or not an exception should be thrown when any arguments are given to a query but not actually used in it.
243     * Unused bindings tend to be bugs or oversights, but are not always.
244     * Defaults to false: unused bindings are not allowed.
245     *
246     * @see org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.Argument
247     * @param unusedBindingAllowed the new setting
248     * @return this
249     */
250    public SqlStatements setUnusedBindingAllowed(boolean unusedBindingAllowed) {
251        this.allowUnusedBindings = unusedBindingAllowed;
252        return this;
253    }
254
255    void customize(Statement statement) throws SQLException {
256        if (queryTimeout != null) {
257            statement.setQueryTimeout(queryTimeout);
258        }
259    }
260
261    @Override
262    public SqlStatements createCopy() {
263        return new SqlStatements(this);
264    }
265
266    Collection<StatementCustomizer> getCustomizers() {
267        return customizers;
268    }
269
270    String preparedRender(String template, StatementContext ctx) {
271        try {
272            return Optional.ofNullable(
273                    templateCache.get(
274                            new AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<>(templateEngine, template),
275                            e -> e.getKey().parse(e.getValue(), ctx.getConfig())
276                                               .orElse(null))) // no parse -> no cache
277                .orElse(cx -> templateEngine.render(template, cx)) // fall-back to old behavior
278                .apply(ctx);
279        } catch (final IllegalArgumentException e) {
280            throw new UnableToCreateStatementException("Exception rendering SQL template", e, ctx);
281        }
282    }
283}
